title: What 3 things can molecules moving with kinetic energy do? - Quora

response.answer_text: They can collide with eachother, elastically, changing their velocities in accordance with the conservation of momentum.They can collide with the walls of their container, applying a pressure to it, bouncing off like billiard balls, with no change in their KE.If at least one of the walls is movable, like a piston, then the pressure will do work upon it, decreasing the average KE, and causing cooling.

Moving molecules can (1)cause heat sensation on objects along their part. (Conversion of mechanical energy to heat) (2)turn a light paddle. (Conversion of energy to mechanical energy) (3)ionize or cause ionization in air. (This depends on the chemistry of the molecules)
